title.value: Adaptive Memory Module Planning and Reasoning for Sequential
title.justification: The title is clearly mentioned at the beginning of the paper and in the header of each page.
title.quote:
A DAPTIVE M EMORY M ODULE
P LANNING AND R EASONING
FOR
S EQUENTIAL

extractions.description: This paper proposes an end-to-end memory-based adaptive learning algorithm to enhance planning capabilities and resource allocation of AI agents in sequential decision-making tasks. The paper aims to improve inference time efficiency and generalization to complex problems through adaptive computation and memory mechanisms.

type.justification: The paper involves conducting experiments and analyzing results to validate the proposed adaptive memory module.
type.quote: We conduct a series of experiments in the Sokoban Puzzle environment to validate our approach.

name.justification: The paper primarily focuses on enhancing planning and reasoning capabilities in sequential decision-making tasks, which is a key aspect of reinforcement learning.
name.quote: Our study borrows concepts from adaptive computation and incorporates memory and reusability mechanisms into agents.

name.justification: The paper discusses meta-learning flexible reasoning strategies in its main contributions.
name.quote: This allows agents to meta-learn flexible reasoning strategies, plan deeper, and efficiently adjust their computation.

name.justification: The paper investigates different memory architectures for the adaptive memory module, indicating a relevance to neural architecture search.
name.quote: We investigate how memory, adaptive computation, and an end-to-end learning approach can be used to build an agent that can meta-learn flexible reasoning strategies.

name.justification: The paper introduces and evaluates this model as a key contribution.
name.quote: We now introduce our agent and its memory module i.e. Adaptive Memory Module (AMM).

is_contributed.justification: The AMM model is proposed and investigated as a primary contribution of the paper.
is_contributed.quote: Inspired by this, we propose and investigate an end-to-end memory-based adaptive learning algorithm to enhance planning capabilities.

is_executed.justification: The paper conducts training and evaluation of the AMM, indicating its execution.
is_executed.quote: We use the behavior cloning algorithm (Torabi et al., 2018), wherein the agent learns from expert trajectories by predicting subsequent actions in the sequence.

is_compared.justification: The AMM is compared with static memory modules in terms of performance and generalization in the experiments.
is_compared.quote: We compare the performance of static vs adaptive models on both in-distribution and out-of-distribution validation sets.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The Adaptive Memory Module is an original contribution of this paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Inspired by this, we propose and investigate an end-to-end memory-based adaptive learning algorithm to enhance planning capabilities.

name.justification: The paper mentions open sourcing this dataset for use in the experiments.
name.quote: We open source all the expert Sokoban trajectories collected for the experiments in this study.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The Sokoban Expert trajectories Data was specifically collected and used for this study.
referenced_paper_title.quote: We open source all the expert Sokoban trajectories collected for the experiments in this study.

name.justification: The paper uses this dataset in experiments to validate the proposed adaptive memory module.
name.quote: The train set consists of 2.1M steps of Sokoban-small-v0 environment that contains 2 boxes.

referenced_paper_title.value: Using abstraction for heuristic search and planning
referenced_paper_title.justification: The dataset generation methodology references Botea (2002).
referenced_paper_title.quote: We use the same methodology as Botea (2002) to generate levels which are then split into train and test sets.

name.justification: The paper uses this dataset in experiments to validate the generalization capability of the adaptive memory module.
name.quote: The validation sets consist of 1000 levels each for Sokoban-small-v0 (2 boxes) and Sokoban-small-v1 (3 boxes).

referenced_paper_title.value: Using abstraction for heuristic search and planning
referenced_paper_title.justification: The dataset generation methodology references Botea (2002).
referenced_paper_title.quote: We use the same methodology as Botea (2002) to generate levels which are then split into train and test sets.

name.justification: The paper explicitly mentions using PonderNet for adaptive computation in the proposed model.
name.quote: In this study we use the PonderNet Algorithm (Banino et al., 2021) to perform adaptive computation and adapt it for the sequential decision making setting.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper for PonderNet is cited in the paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: In this study we use the PonderNet Algorithm (Banino et al., 2021) to perform adaptive computation and adapt it for the sequential decision making setting.
